nodes.title: [Feature Request] Support notifications section
nodes.body:
# Feature or problem?
This is a feature request to manage github notifications. Github notifications are filtered similarly to issues, and prs.

# Solution I'd like:
* An additional set of panels for notifications, and notification filters.
* Keyboard shortcut to mark a notification as done, subscribe, or bookmark 
  * Reading through notifications should be fast, move to next after taking an action 
* Optional shortcut to mark all notifications in the filter at once. 

# Alternates I've considered
Using an alternative plugin to mark all notifications as read.
Yeah I would also like that :) good idea

nodes.title: [BUG] Colors from preview can bleed into PR/Issue list on the next line
nodes.body:
**Describe the bug**

If preview is not wide enough to contain all the colored "labels" at the top, colors can bleed in to PR/Issue list on the next line.  I updated to the latest version this morning, and observed this bug for the first time. So my guess is that this was introduced with ` v4.6.0` or ` v4.7.0`.

**To Reproduce**

Set preview with to something sufficiently small:

```yaml
defaults:
  preview:
    open: true
    width: 40
```

**Expected behavior**

For the colors not to bleed over to the next line :smile: 

**Screenshots**

Look how the green color of the Branch "label" bleeds into the next line.
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0094759b-ef85-42bc-bc43-77b34003d9f1)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Ubuntu

Started facing this bug all of the sudden :(
Are there any known workarounds besides bumping up default preview width to 80?

nodes.title: Add PR approval
nodes.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Sometimes when bumping Terraform module versions, I get a bunch of renovate PRs. I would like to quickly approve them from within dash.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I would like to add "Approve" as a keybinding like "Merge" (https://github.com/dlvhdr/gh-dash/pull/168).
Probably it popups with a message dialog to enter a comment.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Currently I created my own keybinding.

**Additional context**
I would like to implement it in the context of #hacktoberfest which is just around the corner.

cool yeah that's something I definitely want!
I didn't implement it yet as I needed to think more on the UX of it.
Reviewing a PR with `gh pr review` needs flags specifying approving/rejecting and a message body.
I thought I could implement an generic input mechanism similar to vim's `vim.ui.select`.

Something like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6196971/190410301-131d2c0f-1eec-43a5-ad23-2f66422974b8.png)
Would it make sense to use something like the modal window from tview (https://github.com/rivo/tview/wiki/Modal) ?
I'm not sure that'll work with bubbletea, but if it were to work, do you know how much that'll add to the binary size?

No idea. Honestly,  I'm more or less a copy/paste "dev" as my background is more Ops than Dev. üôÇ 

But as said I would like to try a PR for #hacktoberfest. Are you fine with that?
Yeah sure, give it a try
After a quick search I know now that bubbletea is already a TUI lib üí° and that https://github.com/erikgeiser/promptkit could be a good fit. I will explore in the bubbles field.
Yes check out https://github.com/charmbracelet/bubbles
This would be a big help for us since most of our repos require approval before a PR can be merged
Got it :) Making someone be able to live in the terminal is definitely a motivator ü•∞

@rpdelaney but what about reviewing the PR before approving it? You would still need a way to add comments on lines in files. This can be done with octo nvim but if you use it then you can approve the PR through its interface.
@dudicoco Not every PR requires that I add comments.

For anyone curious, you can use gh-dash with [Gum](https://github.com/charmbracelet/gum) also from charm to create prompts with input.

Here is how you can do a pr approval with a comment. Can adjust for request changes, text blocks over inputs etc.

```yaml
keybindings:
  prs:
    - key: a
      command: >
        gh pr review --repo {{.RepoName}} --approve --body "$(gum input --prompt='Approval Comment: ')" {{.PrNumber}}

```

```
keybindings:
  prs:
    - key: a
      command: >
        gh pr review --repo {{.RepoName}} --approve
```
I did not grok that this was possible already in gh-dash. Thank you so much.

Figured this out today, but left me with a quick question‚Äîis there a way to adjust the `?` help text? Asking because inevitably I'll need to check my own config several times before I "learn" my own key bindings üòÇ It would be nice to be able to see my updated key binding in the help text.

nodes.title: Some suggestions to the documents
nodes.body:
I just want to address some issues I met and hope it could help others. 

## The folder that stores the config

According https://pkg.go.dev/os#UserConfigDir, the folder is different in each OS.  it is `~/Library/Application Support/gh-dash` on Mac. 

Don't waste your time struggling with the `~/.config/gh-dash` folder..

## The icons on the UI

You may not see the icons correctly even though you already have installed and used a nerd font. 

That is because some of the icons need to be rendered with the `bold` style. Make sure you have set the bold font correctly.
Fixed in #135
